occurrences.line_text: Faire Sir at that, which ye so much embrace?
Dissembled faire, and faynd to ouersee.
And counselled faire Alma, how to gouerne well.
Were painted faire with memorable gestes,
Ne vnder Sunne, that shines so wide and faire,
Borne of faire Inogene of Italy;
He lou'd faire Ladie Estrild, lewdly lou'd,
Als his faire Leman, flying through a brooke,
The faire Sabrina almost dead with feare,
And happie father of faire progeny:
But three faire daughters, which were well vptraind,
Whose simple answere, wanting colours faire
Next great Gurgustus, then faire CÃ¦cily
Faire Helena, the fairest liuing wight;
Through his faire daughters face, & flattring word;
He left two sonnes, of which faire Elferon
Faire mote he thee, the prowest and most gent,
Eft fierce returning, as a Faulcon faire
Both faire and fruitfull, and the ground dispred
Of her faire twins was there deliuered,
Faire Sir, be not displeasd, if disobayd:
They were faire Ladies, till they fondly striu'd
O thou faire sonne of gentle Faery,
And the faire land it selfe did plainly show.
Strowed with pleasauns, whose faire grassy ground
Faire Daphne Phoebus hart with loue did gore;
Or sweet Parnasse, the haunt of Muses faire;
Much wondred Guyon at the faire aspect
Some like faire Emeraudes, not yet well ripened.
Clad in faire weedes, but fowle disordered,
That so faire wine-presse made the wine more sweet:
And that, which all faire workes doth most aggrace,
Out of this fountaine, sweet and faire to see,
As that faire Starre, the messenger of morne,
And her faire lockes, which formerly were bownd
So that faire spectacle from him was reft,
Yet that, which reft it, no lesse faire was fownd:
Was the faire Witch her selfe now solacing,
Many faire Ladies, and lasciuious boyes,
Ah see, who so faire thing doest faine to see,
And her faire eyes sweet smyling in delight,
The faire Enchauntresse, so vnwares opprest,
faire Florimell is chaced:
Of the faire Alma greatly were procured,
They spide a knight, that towards pricked faire,
And hasting towards him gan faire perswade,
And her faire yellow locks behind her flew,
The whiles faire Britomart, whose constant mind,
But faire before the gate a spatious plaine,
Within this castle wall a Ladie faire,
For thy, faire Sir, yours be the Damozell,
Faire Ladies, and of many a gentle knight,
The faire Adonis, turned to a flowre,
As when faire Cynthia, in darkesome night,
With which faire Britomart gaue light vnto the day.
All were faire knights, and goodly well beseene,
But to faire Britomart they all but shadowes beene.
Whom when the Lady saw so faire a wight.
Faire Ladies, that to loue captiued arre,
The Lady did faire Britomart entreat,
And to faire semblaunce doth light faith annexe;
Scorne the faire offer of good will profest;
But with faire countenaunce, as beseemed best,
And all the while faire Malecasta bent
Faire Malecasta, whose engrieued spright
That was with gold and Ermines faire enueloped.
Be thou faire Britomart, whose prayse I write,
Of sundry things faire purpose gan to find,
Faire Lady she him seemd, like Lady drest,
Faire Sir, I let you weete, that from the howre
Her shortly answered; Faire martiall Mayd
Therefore, faire Damzell, be ye well aware,
Ah, but if reason faire might you perswade,
One day it fortuned, faire Britomart
That deckt the azure field with her faire pouldred skin.
And thinke of that faire visage, written in her hart.
Their fit disports with faire delight doe chose,
And her faire deawy eies with kisses deare
Sweet loue such lewdnes bands from his faire companie.
For the faire Damzell from the holy herse
On a faire Ladie Nonne, that whilome hight
Thrice shined faire, and thrice seem'd dim and wan,
Ne ye faire Britomartis, thus arayd,
As faire Aurora rising hastily,
But the third time shall faire accordaunce make:
Their beames shall oft breake forth, that men them faire may see.
Faire Angela (quoth she) men do her call,
No whit lesse faire, then terrible in fight:
Therefore faire Infant her ensample make
Faire Britomart, and that same Armory
Faire Florimell of Arthur is
That in late yeares so faire a blossome bare,
So the faire Britomart hauing disclo'st
Eftsoones her goodly shield addressing faire,
And the faire flowres, that decked him afore;
And euer from faire Ladies loue did fly;
Yet many Ladies faire did oft complaine,
Gay girlonds, from the Sun their forheads faire to shade.
She flong, and her faire deawy lockes yrent,
Oft did he wish, that Lady faire mote bee
The prayses of high God he faire displayes,
Her faire lockes in rich circlet be enrold,
And is ycleped Florimell the faire,
Faire Florimell belou'd of many a knight,
Therefore, faire Sir, for loue of knighthood gent,
To that faire Damzell: Him he chaced long
Belphoebe was her name, as faire as Phoebus sunne.
In whose faire eyes, like lamps of quenched fire,
The bud of youth to blossome faire began,
A faire Pauilion, scarcely to be seene,
And his foule sore reduced to faire plight:
From her faire eyes and gracious countenaunce.
But loue so faire a Lady, that his life releast?
Faire death it is to shonne more shame, to dy:
Dye rather, dye, then euer so faire loue forsake.
Which seeing faire Belphoebe, gan to feare,
She did it faire dispred, and let to florish faire.
She did it faire dispred, and let to florish faire.
Faire ympes of beautie, whose bright shining beames
With this faire flowre your goodly girlonds dight,
To youre faire selues a faire ensample frame,
To youre faire selues a faire ensample frame,
Of this faire virgin, this Belphoebe faire,
Of this faire virgin, this Belphoebe faire,
The birth of faire Belphoebe and
Well may I weene, faire Ladies, all this while
But to this faire Belphoebe in her berth
And Phoebus with faire beames did her adorne,
Her mother was the faire Chrysogonee,
Faire Amoretta in the second place:
By what straunge accident faire Chrysogone
When Titan faire his beames did display,
And his faire sister for creation
It fortuned, faire Venus hauing lost
The house of goodly formes and faire aspects,
Goodly she gan faire Cytherea greet,
Faire sister, ill beseemes it to vpbrayd
For he is faire and fresh in face and guize,
Faire Crysogone in slombry traunce whilere:
Vnwares had borne two babes, as faire as springing day.
So faire a place, as Nature can deuize:
Th'one faire and fresh, the other old and dride:
And that faire flowre of beautie fades away,
To see so faire things mard, and spoyled quight:
There wont faire Venus often to enioy
Aside, with faire Adonis playes his wanton parts.
And his true loue faire Psyche with him playes,
Faire Psyche to him lately reconcyld,
Hither great Venus brought this infant faire,
To all faire Ladies, that doe liue on ground.
So fled faire Florimell from her vaine feare,
But the faire Virgin was so meeke and mild,
Girlonds of flowres sometimes for her faire hed
That their faire guest was gone, they both begonne
Whereon faire Florimell was wont to ride,
To that faire Mayd, the flowre of womens pride;
She turnd, and semblaunce of faire fight did make;
Which reft from him so faire a cheuisaunce:
Then breake the vow, that to faire Columbell
But a faire virgin, that in martiall law,
So well I to faire Ladies seruice did,
Yet was she faire, and in her countenance
To tell what tydings of faire Florimell became.
As Florimells faire haire: and in the stead
And faire resemblance aboue all the rest,
To walke the woods with that his Idole faire,
He seeing with that Chorle so faire a wight,
To looke on her faire face, and marke her snowy skin.
And blubbred face with teares of her faire eyes:
And there with many gentle termes her faire besought.
And offered faire gifts t'allure her sight,
They spyde a knight faire pricking on the plaine,
And suddein parture of faire Florimell,
And all faire Ladies may for euer sory be.
Then said, Faire Sir, how may I weene it trew,
Faire Sir (quoth he) well may it you succeed,
Vnfit faire Ladies seruice to supply;
And the faire welkin fowly ouercast,
That this faire many were compeld at last,
And with faire treatie pacifide their ire,
Which the faire feature of her limbs did hyde,
Through gracious regard of her faire eye,
On her faire face so did he feede his fill,
By their faire handling, put into Malbeccoes cape.
Faire Helene, flowre of beautie excellent,
And saw the fieldes of faire Scamander strowne
On faire Oenone got a louely boy,
But for faire Ladies loue, and glories gaine,
Anchyses sonne begot of Venus faire,
Where faire it florished, and long time it stoud,
Faire Lincolne, both renowmed far away,
Vpon his lips hong faire Dame Hellenore,
Faire Britomart and that same Faerie knight
And his faire wife, whom honest long he kept vneath.
Yet bore so faire a saile, that none espyde
Whom she hath vow'd to dub a faire Cucquold.
This second Hellene, faire Dame Hellenore,
And Night, the patronesse of loue-stealth faire,
And all faire Ladies magnifie your might,
Faire Hellenore, with girlonds all bespred,
That through the helpe of his faire hornes on hight,
And ye faire Ladies, that your kingdomes make
And of faire Britomart ensample take,
Faire Britomart so long him followed,
For whom so faire a Lady feeles so sore a wound.
Abiecting, th'earth with his faire forhead strooke:
Therefore, faire Sir, do comfort to you take,
At least it faire endeuour will apply.
Faire Amoret must dwell in wicked chaines,
Many faire pourtraicts, and many a faire feate,
Many faire pourtraicts, and many a faire feate,
Now like a Ram, faire Helle to peruart,
Him selfe he chaung'd faire Danaï¿½ to vew,
To win faire Leda to his louely trade:
And brushing his faire brest, did her inuade;
But faire Alcmena better match did make,
Againe, when as the Troiane boy so faire
And thou, faire Phoebus, in thy colours bright
To loue faire Daphne, which thee loued lesse:
So louedst thou the faire Coronis deare:
All which in that faire arras was most liuely writ.
And Aeolus faire daughter Arne hight.
On whom he got faire Pegasus, that flitteth in the ayre.
And into her faire bosome made his grapes decline.
And at the vpper end of that faire rowme,
That wondrous sight faire Britomart amazed,
Whence Britomart redeemes faire
Faire heauen with an vniuersall cloud,
And her faire lockes were wouen vp in gold;
Goodly adorned, and exceeding faire:
Thus marched these sixe couples forth in faire degree.
After all these there marcht a most faire Dame,
Faire Dame he might behold in perfect kind;
Wherewith the worlds faire beautie she hath blent:
That little drops empurpled her faire brest.
And her faire locks vp stared stiffe on end,
Before faire Britomart, she fell prostrate,
Henceforth faire Lady comfort to you take,
To haue efforst the loue of that faire lasse,
But most faire Amoret, whose gentle spright
But she faire Lady ouercommen quight
That they had beene that faire Hermaphrodite,
And ye faire swayns, after your long turmoyle,
To blot her with dishonor of so faire a pray.
Amongst all which was none more faire then shee,
And outward shew faire semblance they did beare;
For which the three faire Goddesses did striue:
For all this worlds faire workmanship she tride,
With his faire paragon, his conquests part,
Faire Sir, of friendship let me now you pray,
List not to hearke, but made this faire denyall;
Seeing so faire indeede, as he did say,
Fayrest of faire, that fairenesse doest excell,
That lost faire Ladies ornament should weare,
And of all old dislikes they made faire weather,
Then life to hazard for faire Ladies looke;
Like three faire branches budding farre and wide,
Thereto she was right faire, when so her face
Which faire aduenture when Cambello spide,
And therein sate a Ladie passing faire
Faire Canacee, as fresh as morning rose,
But faire Cambina with perswasions myld,
For that rich girdle of faire Florimell,
Another like, that were like faire and bright,
There this faire crewe arriuing, did diuide
For he me seemes most fit the faire to serue,
Shall fall the girdle of faire Florimell:
His faire Cambina, couered with a veale;
His Lucida, that was full faire and sheene,
So many faire did see, as here he might haue sought.
Yet thought that Florimell was not so faire as shee.
Alas for pittie that so faire a crew,
To worke such outrage on so faire a creature?
And you faire Ladie knight, my dearest Dame,
Till Glauce thus; Faire Sir, be nought dismayd
With faire entreatie and sweet blandishment,
With whom she went to seeke faire Amoret,
So whylome didst thou to faire Florimell;
The whiles faire Amoret, of nought affeard,
Pursuing that faire Lady full of feare;
From her faire eyes wiping the deawy wet,
And his faire lockes, that wont with ointment sweet
Whose tender heart the faire Belphebe had,
Vntill she came where wonned his Belphebe faire.
Then faire grew foule, and foule grew faire in sight,
Then faire grew foule, and foule grew faire in sight,
Faire Amoret, that scarcely she could ryde;
Ne woman yet so faire, but he her brought
The faire Poeana; who seemes outwardly
So faire, as euer yet saw liuing eie:
She were as faire as any vnder skie.
Him chaunst; in stead of his ï¿½mylia faire
Of faire Poeana I receiued was,
My former hardnesse first I faire excusd;
For though Poeana were as faire as morne,
The faire Poeana playing on a Rote,
Whom soone as faire AEmylia beheld,
That faire Poeana them beholding both,
And for more ioy, that captiue Lady faire
The faire Poeana he enlarged free;
For though she were most faire, and goodly dyde,
And she whom Nature did so faire create,
Faire Amoret, whom Fortune by bequest
To weet faire Britomart, them late had foyled
For that faire Ladies loue: past perils well apay.
That was a temple faire and auncient,
With curious Corbes and pendants grauen faire,
There reared was a castle faire and strong,
VVhose euer be the shield, faire Amoret be his.
Could terrifie from Fortunes faire adward:
Faire lawnds, to take the sunne in season dew;
But being faire and brickle, likest glasse did seeme.
To let faire Florimell in bands remayne,
Faire Amphitrite, most diuinely faire,
Faire Amphitrite, most diuinely faire,
And faire Euphaemus, that vpon them go'th
The faire Tindarid lasse, he him fortold,
Faire Ister, flowing from the mountaines hie;
Of that faire City, wherein make abode
And Bristow faire, which on his waues he builded hath.
Sixe valiant Knights, of one faire Nymphe yborne,
Of the faire Nimph Rheusa wandring there.
These three faire sons, which being the[n]ce forth powrd
By faire Kilkenny and Rosseponte boord,
Her siluer feet, faire washt against this day:
Swift Proto, milde Eucrate, Thetis faire,
Amongst the rest, was faire Cymodoce,
Some while he thought, by faire and humble wise
That had despisde so chast and faire a dame,
Now with faire speches, now with threatnings sterne,
And wooe with faire intreatie, to disclose,
So faire a wife for her sonne Marinell.
And gins to spread his leafe before the faire sunshine.
And the first blossome of faire vertue bare,
By faire Astrï¿½a, with great industrie,
The faire Irena with his foule misdeede,
Thereto she is full faire, and rich attired,
To cease his outrage, and him faire besought,
By the faire lockes, and fowly did array,
The spousals of faire Florimell,
Both darting forth faire beames to each mans eye,
The semblant of this false by his faire beauties Queene.
A great increase in her faire blushing face;
As when the daughter of Thaumantes faire,
About their middles that faire belt to knit;
And turne we here to this faire furrowes end
Now with faire words; but words did little good,
That further mayd, hight Philtera the faire,
But when as daies faire shinie-beame, yclowded
As the faire Moone in her most full aspect,
In her faire visage voide of ornament,
Faire Damzell, that with ruth (as I perceaue)
And try if thou by faire entreatie, can
And with faire words, fit for the time and place,
So daily he faire semblant did her shew,
Whom she saluting faire, faire resaluted was.
Whom she saluting faire, faire resaluted was.
So faire and tender, without staine or spot,
Such wondrous powre hath wemens faire aspect,
Faire Britomart in languor and vnrest,
So faire a creature, and so wondrous bold,
To faire accordaunce, and both faults to shade,
Of finall peace and faire attonement,
And his faire limbs left in the woods forlorne;
Of which he in faire weather wont to take great store.
A beuie of faire Virgins clad in white,
As a faire stoupe of her high soaring thought,
First gan he tell, how this that seem'd so faire
Few perling drops from her faire lampes of light;
Them ouertooke, and their faire blossomes blasted,
Built a faire Chappell, and an Altar framed
The which good Fortune to him offred faire.
On faire Irene in her affliction,
Too much am I to blame for that faire Maide,
He drawing neare, began to greete them faire,
And that faire Lady, which in that vprore
Yet wondrous faire she was, and richly clad
To so faire Ladie, as ye seeme in sight,
Who for like cause faire Belge did oppresse,
To faire Irena, at her feet did fall,
Which carry colours faire, that feeble eies misdeeme.
So faire a patterne finde, where may be seene
Faire Lords and Ladies, which about you dwell,
For his faire vsage and conditions sound,
With a faire Damzell, my beloued deare,
He following that faire aduantage fast,
And them beside a Ladie faire he saw,
Yet seuenteene yeares, but tall and faire of face
On her faire feet by his horse side did pas
Faire was the Ladie sure, that mote content
Whom when my knight did see so louely faire,
Of that faire bootie, and with bitter wracke
Faire gentle swayne, and yet as stout as fayre,
Faire Emiline, conceiuing then great feare
And thus replide; Faire chyld, the high desire
Long fed his greedie eyes with the faire sight
Therefore faire Lady lay aside this griefe,
Faire Lady let it not you seeme disgrace,
By a faire Lady, and a straunger Knight,
But that faire Lady would be cheard for nought,
But faire Priscilla (so that Lady hight)
Where when he saw his faire Priscilla by,
And eke that Lady his faire louely lasse.
He passed forth with her in faire array,
To giue faire colour to that Ladies cause in sight.
And eke the Lady was full faire to see,
The faire Serena (so his Lady hight)
He chaunst to spie a faire and stately place,
With a faire Lady lincked by his syde,
To whom faire semblance, as he could, he shewed
He to her drew, and with faire blandishment
And hauing cheared her, thus said; faire Dame,
Ne euer saw faire guize, ne learned good,
With that aloude the faire Serena cryde
With such faire words she did their heate asswage,
Seem'd like a groue faire braunched ouer hed:
Therein he them full faire did entertaine
But faire Serene all night could take no rest,
And thus he to them sayd; Faire daughter Dame,
And you faire sonne, which here thus long now lie
A faire young Mayden, full of comely glee;
With a faire Mayden clad in mourning weed,
Which faire Serene to him deliuered had,
When as the gentle Squire, with faire Serene,
The faire Serena, when she saw him fall
Of faire Serena, who as earst you heard,
Like the faire yuory shining they did see,
Saw a faire damzell, which did weare a crowne
To helpe faire Pastorella, home to driue
That twixt his pleasing tongue, and her faire hew,
Dayly beholding the faire Pastorell,
With the faire Pastorella euery day,
As they are wont in faire sunshynie weather,
With this faire Mayd, and in her mynde the seeds
To winne the loue of the faire Pastorell;
Whilest Calidore does follow that faire Mayd,
Whilest his faire Pastorella was elsewhere,
Is borrowed of them. But that faire one,
By him begot of faire Eurynome,
Next faire Aglaia, last Thalia merry:
Where his faire Pastorella did remaine:
Before the feete of the faire Pastorell;
Faire Pastorella, sorrowfull and sad,
Or sold againe. Now when faire Pastorell
Like as is now befalne to this faire Mayd,
Faire Pastorell, of whom is now my song,
Faire Pastorella, whose sad mournefull hew
Like the faire Morning clad in misty fog did shew.
By his faire patients side with sorrowfull regret.
Gan to inquire for that faire shepherdesse,
Before I saw faire Pastorella dye.
Or how faire Pastorell should haue bene sold
And faire bespoke with words, that he at last agreed.
The whiles faire Pastorell through great affright
Faire Pastorella from those Brigants powre,
That like a rose her silken leaues did faire vnfold.
No lesse did tender the faire Pastorell,
So taking leaue of his faire Pastorell,
What did betide to the faire Pastorell,
Who in a morning, when this Mayden faire
In her conceiptfull mynd, that this faire Mayd
When she so faire a daughter saw suruiue,
Acknowledg'd for his owne faire Pastorell.
That feigning dreame, and that faire-forged Spright
Gan fairely couch his speare, and towards ride:
And glauncing downe his shield, from blame him fairely blest.
With fire not made to burne, but fairely for to shyne.
With gentle wordes he can her fairely greet,
The Witch approching gan him fairely greet,
There fairely them receiues a gentle Squire,
Him dearely kist, and fairely eke besought
The knight gan fairely couch his steadie speare,
The which afore is fairely to be kend,
So fairely dight, when she in presence came,
Well may she speede and fairely finish her intent.
And fairely fare on foot, how euer loth;
Thus fairely she attempered her feast,
But fairely tempring fond desire subdewd,
And passed fairely forth. He turning taile,
Bidding his winged vessell fairely forward fly.
For thy great Mammon fairely he besought,
And entertained them right fairely, as befell.
Of hewen stone the porch was fairely wrought,
And fairely feasted, as so noble knights she ought.
Fairely to rise, and her adorned hed
So is his angry courage fairely pacifyde.
But fairely well she thriu'd, and well did brooke
And fairely them saluted, as became,
Yet fairely well he did them all dismay:
And pacing fairely forth, did bid all haile,
Adowne her backe, the which it fairely blest
Till Britomart him fairely thus behight;
But Artegall him fairely gan asswage,
Them fairely entertaynd with curt'sies meete,
And fairely did dissemble her sad thoughts vnrest.
Fayrest of faire, that fairenesse doest excell,
When fairer faces were bid standen by:
Thousand times fairer then her mortall hew,
Fairer and nobler liueth none this howre,
That fairer seemes, the lesse ye see her may;
